intro: Verbascum borisii-regis, commonly known as the Borussia knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
